verbs.description: It [V: appeared] [ARG1: Trump had agreed a fragile consensus with the other members of the G-7 until he blew that apart with a salvo of tweets fired from Air Force One] .
It appeared Trump [V: had] agreed a fragile consensus with the other members of the G-7 until he blew that apart with a salvo of tweets fired from Air Force One .
It appeared [ARG0: Trump] had [V: agreed] [ARG1: a fragile consensus with the other members of the G-7] [ARGM-TMP: until he blew that apart with a salvo of tweets fired from Air Force One] .

It appeared Trump had agreed a fragile consensus with the other members of the G-7 until [ARG0: he] [V: blew] [ARG1: that] [ARGM-ADV: apart] [ARGM-MNR: with a salvo of tweets fired from Air Force One] .
It appeared Trump had agreed a fragile consensus with the other members of the G-7 until he blew that apart with a salvo of [ARG1: tweets] [V: fired] [ARGM-DIR: from Air Force One] .
